member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.BarcodeSettings
member.summary: Represents a set of settings controlling barcode generation while assembling a document.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.BarcodeSettings.GraphicsUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets a graphics unit used to measure and . The default value is .

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.BarcodeSettings.BaseXDimension
member.summary: Gets or sets a base x-dimension, that is, the smallest width of the unit of barcode bars and spaces. Measured in .
member.remarks: When barcode scaling is applied through a template, an actual x-dimension is calculated upon the base x-dimension and a scaling factor.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.BarcodeSettings.BaseYDimension
member.summary: Gets or sets a base y-dimension, that is, the smallest height of the unit of 2D barcode modules. Measured in .

remarks.para: Barcodes of some types (such as data matrix) may ignore an y-dimension and use an x-dimension for both width and height units.
When barcode scaling is applied through a template, an actual y-dimension is calculated upon the base y-dimension and a scaling factor.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.BarcodeSettings.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal and vertical resolution of a barcode image being generated. Measured in dots per inch. The default value is 96.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.BarcodeSettings.XResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal resolution of a barcode image being generated. Measured in dots per inch. The default value is 96.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.BarcodeSettings.YResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical resolution of a barcode image being generated. Measured in dots per inch. The default value is 96.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.BarcodeSettings.UseAutoCorrection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an invalid barcode value should be corrected automatically (if possible) to fit the barcode's specification or an exception should be thrown to indicate the error. The default value is true.
member.remarks: The auto-correction is not possible for Databar barcodes.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.DataSourceInfo
member.summary: Provides information on a single data source object to be used to assemble a document from a template.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.DataSourceInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class without any properties specified.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.DataSourceInfo.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class with the data source object specified.

remarks.para: The data source object can be of one of the following types:

list.item: Any other arbitrary non-dynamic and non-anonymous .NET type

remarks.para: For information on how to work with data sources of different types in template documents, see template syntax reference (https://docs.groupdocs.com/display/assemblynet/Template+Syntax+-+Part+1+of+2#TemplateSyntax-Part1of2-UsingDataSources).

member.param: The data source object.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.DataSourceInfo.#ctor(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class with the data source object and its name specified.

remarks.para: The data source object can be of one of the following types:

list.item: Any other arbitrary non-dynamic and non-anonymous .NET type

remarks.para: For information on how to work with data sources of different types in template documents, see template syntax reference (https://docs.groupdocs.com/display/assemblynet/Template+Syntax+-+Part+1+of+2#TemplateSyntax-Part1of2-UsingDataSources).
When the name of the data source object is specified, you can access the data source object and its members in a template document using the name.

When the name of the data source object is null or empty, you can still access members of the data source object in a template document using context object member access (see Template Syntax Reference for more information), but you cannot access the data source object itself.
When passing multiple instances to , only the name of the first data source object can be null or empty. Names of the rest ones must be specified and unique.

member.param: The data source object.
The name of the data source object to be used to access the data source object in a template document.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.DataSourceInfo.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source object.

remarks.para: The data source object can be of one of the following types:

list.item: Any other arbitrary non-dynamic and non-anonymous .NET type

remarks.para: For information on how to work with data sources of different types in template documents, see template syntax reference (https://docs.groupdocs.com/display/assemblynet/Template+Syntax+-+Part+1+of+2#TemplateSyntax-Part1of2-UsingDataSources).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.DataSourceInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the data source object to be used to access the data source object in a template document.

remarks.para: When the name of the data source object is specified, you can access the data source object and its members in a template document using the name.

When the name of the data source object is null or empty, you can still access members of the data source object in a template document using context object member access (see Template Syntax Reference for more information), but you cannot access the data source object itself.
When passing multiple instances to , only the name of the first data source object can be null or empty. Names of the rest ones must be specified and unique.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataLoadOptions
member.summary: Represents options for parsing CSV data.
member.remarks: An instance of this class can be passed into constructors of .

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataLoadOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class with default options.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataLoadOptions.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class with specifying whether CSV data contains column names at the first line.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataLoadOptions.HasHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the first line of CSV data contains column names.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataLoadOptions.Delimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to be used as a column delimiter.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataLoadOptions.QuoteChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that is used to quote field values.

remarks.para: The default value is '"' (quotation mark).
Double the character to place it into quoted text.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataLoadOptions.CommentChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that is used to comment lines of CSV data.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataSource
member.summary: Provides access to data of a CSV file or stream to be used while assembling a document.

remarks.para: To access data of the corresponding file or stream while assembling a document, pass an instance of this class as a data source to one of .AssembleDocument overloads.

In template documents, a instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. For more information, see template syntax reference (https://docs.groupdocs.com/display/assemblynet/Template+Syntax+-+Part+1+of+2#TemplateSyntax-Part1of2-UsingDataSources).

Data types of comma-separated values are determined automatically upon their string representations. So in template documents, you can work with typed values rather than just strings. The engine is capable to automatically recognize values of the following types:
Note that for automatic recognition of data types to work, string representations of comma-separated values should be formed using invariant culture settings.
To override default behavior of CSV data loading, initialize and pass a instance to a constructor of this class.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataSource.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new data source with data from a CSV file using default options for parsing CSV data.
member.param: The path to the CSV file to be used as the data source.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataSource.#ctor(System.String,GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataLoadOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new data source with data from a CSV file using the specified options for parsing CSV data.
member.param: The path to the CSV file to be used as the data source.
Options for parsing the CSV data.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataSource.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new data source with data from a CSV stream using default options for parsing CSV data.
member.param: The stream of CSV data to be used as the data source.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataSource.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.CsvDataLoadOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new data source with data from a CSV stream using the specified options for parsing CSV data.
member.param: The stream of CSV data to be used as the data source.
Options for parsing the CSV data.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable
member.summary: Provides access to data of a single table (or spreadsheet) located in an external document to be used while assembling a document.

remarks.para: For documents of Spreadsheet file formats, a instance represents a single sheet. For documents of other file formats, a instance represents a single table.
To access data of the corresponding table while assembling a document, pass an instance of this class as a data source to one of .AssembleDocument overloads.
In template documents, a instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. See template syntax reference for more information.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class using default .
member.param: The path to a document containing the table to be accessed.
The zero-based index of the table in the document.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class.
member.param: The path to a document containing the table to be accessed.
The zero-based index of the table in the document.
A set of options controlling extraction of data from the table. If null, default options are applied.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class using default .
member.param: The stream containing a document with the table to be accessed.
The zero-based index of the table in the document.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class.
member.param: The stream containing a document with the table to be accessed.
The zero-based index of the table in the document.
A set of options controlling extraction of data from the table. If null, default options are applied.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this table used to access the table's data in a template document passed to .

remarks.para: If the table's name is read from a document, the name is automatically corrected so that it to be valid. However, if the table's name is set manually through this property and the name is invalid, an exception is thrown.
The table's name is considered to be valid, if the following conditions are met:

list.item: The name's first character is a letter or underscore.
The rest of the name's characters are letters, underscores, digits, or the following characters: '@', '#', '$'.
The corresponding object does not contain a instance with the same name.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable.IndexInDocument
member.summary: Gets the original zero-based index of the corresponding table as per the source document.
member.remarks: Depending on an implementation provided, this index may differ from the index of this instance within the table collection of the corresponding instance, if any.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable.Columns
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects representing columns of the corresponding table.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableCollection
member.summary: Represents a read-only collection of objects of a particular instance.
member.remarks: The collection is filled automatically while loading the corresponding tables from a document and can not be modified. However, properties of objects contained within the collection can be modified.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator to iterate objects of this collection.
member.returns: An enumerator to iterate objects of this collection.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableCollection.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this collection contains a table with the specified name.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of a table to look for.
member.returns: A value indicating whether this collection contains a table with the specified name.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableCollection.Contains(GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this collection contains the specified table.
member.param: A table to look for.
member.returns: A value indicating whether this collection contains the specified table.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableCollection.IndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of a table with the specified name within this collection.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of a table to find.
member.returns: The zero-based index of a table with the specified name, or -1 if the table does not exist in this collection.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableCollection.IndexOf(GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTable)
member.summary: Returns the index of the specified table within this collection.
member.param: A table to find.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the specified table, or -1 if the table does not exist in this collection.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a instance from the collection at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the table to return.
member.returns: A instance from the collection at the specified index.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a instance with the specified name from the collection.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of the table to return.
member.returns: A instance with the specified name from the collection or null if such an instance does not exist.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the total number of objects in the collection.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableColumn
member.summary: Represents a single column of a particular object.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableColumn.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this column used to access the column's data in a template document passed to .

remarks.para: If the column's name is read from a document (see ), the name is automatically corrected so that it to be valid. However, if the column's name is set manually through this property and the name is invalid, an exception is thrown.
The column's name is considered to be valid, if the following conditions are met:

list.item: The name's first character is a letter or underscore.
The rest of the name's characters are letters, underscores, digits, or the following characters: '@', '#', '$'.
The corresponding object does not contain a instance with the same name.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableColumn.IndexInDocument
member.summary: Gets the original zero-based index of the corresponding table column as per the source document.
member.remarks: Depending on specified, this index may differ from the index of this instance within the column collection of the corresponding instance.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableColumn.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of cell values in this column.

remarks.para: For documents of non-Spreadsheet file formats, the initial type is always automatically determined as string. For documents of Spreadsheet file formats, the initial type is automatically determined depending on corresponding cell values.
If cells of a particular Spreadsheet column contain values of different types, then the column's initial type is also automatically determined as string.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableColumn.AllowsNull
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether cells in this column contain null values or not.
member.remarks: Undefined and error values in cells of Spreadsheet documents are also considered to be null.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableColumnCollection
member.summary: Represents a read-only collection of objects of a particular instance.
member.remarks: The collection is filled automatically while loading the corresponding table from a document and can not be modified. However, properties of objects contained within the collection can be modified.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableColumnCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator to iterate objects of this collection.
member.returns: An enumerator to iterate objects of this collection.

member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this collection contains a column with the specified name.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of a column to look for.
member.returns: A value indicating whether this collection contains a column with the specified name.

member.returns: A value indicating whether this collection contains the specified column.

member.summary: Returns the index of a column with the specified name within this collection.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of a column to find.
member.returns: The zero-based index of a column with the specified name, or -1 if the column does not exist in this collection.

member.summary: Returns the index of the specified column within this collection.
member.param: A column to find.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the specified column, or -1 if the column does not exist in this collection.

member.summary: Gets a instance from the collection at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the column to return.
member.returns: A instance from the collection at the specified index.

member.summary: Gets a instance with the specified name from the collection.
member.param: The case-insensitive name of the column to return.
member.returns: A instance with the specified name from the collection or null if such an instance does not exist.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableColumnCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the total number of objects in the collection.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableLoadArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the method.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableLoadArgs.TableIndex
member.summary: Gets the zero-based index of the corresponding document table to be loaded.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableLoadArgs.IsLoaded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the corresponding document table is to be loaded or not. The default value is true.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableLoadArgs.Options
member.summary: Gets or sets to be used while loading the corresponding document table. The default value is null, which means that default are to be applied.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableOptions
member.summary: Provides a set of options to control extraction of data from a document table.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableOptions.MinRowIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the smallest zero-based index of a row to be extracted from a document table. The default value is negative which means that the smallest row index is not limited.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableOptions.MaxRowIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the largest zero-based index of a row to be extracted from a document table. The default value is negative which means that the largest row index is not limited.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableOptions.MinColumnIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the smallest zero-based index of a column to be extracted from a document table. The default value is negative which means that the smallest column index is not limited.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableOptions.MaxColumnIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the largest zero-based index of a column to be extracted from a document table. The default value is negative which means that the largest column index is not limited.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableOptions.FirstRowContainsColumnNames
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether column names are to be obtained from the first extracted row of a document table. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If column names are not set to be obtained from the first extracted row of a document table, default column names are used instead. For documents of Spreadsheet file formats, default column names are defined as A, B, C, ... Z, AA, AB, and so on. For documents of other file formats, default column names are defined as Column1, Column2, Column3, and so on.

The child column of the relation.
member.returns: The created relation.

member.summary: Removes the specified relation from the collection.

member.summary: Removes the relation at the specified index from the collection.

member.summary: Clears the collection of any relations.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableSet
member.summary: Provides access to data of multiple tables (or spreadsheets) located in an external document to be used while assembling a document. Also, enables to define parent-child relations for the document tables thus simplifying access to related data within template documents.

remarks.para: For documents of Spreadsheet file formats, a instance represents a set of sheets. For documents of other file formats, a instance represents a set of tables.
To access data of the corresponding tables while assembling a document, pass an instance of this class as a data source to one of .AssembleDocument overloads.
In template documents, a instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. See template syntax reference for more information.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableSet.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class loading all tables from a document using default .
member.param: The path to a document containing tables to be accessed.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableSet.#ctor(System.String,GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.IDocumentTableLoadHandler)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class.
member.param: The path to a document containing tables to be accessed.
An implementation controlling how document tables are loaded.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableSet.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class loading all tables from a document using default .
member.param: The stream containing a document with tables to be accessed.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableSet.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.IDocumentTableLoadHandler)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class.
member.param: The stream containing a document with tables to be accessed.
An implementation controlling how document tables are loaded.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableSet.Tables
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects representing tables of this set.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableSet.Relations
member.summary: Gets the collection of parent-child relations defined for document tables of this set.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.IDocumentTableLoadHandler
member.summary: Overrides default loading of objects while creating a instance.
member.remarks: Implement this interface if you want to discard loading of specific objects or provide specific for document tables being loaded.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.IDocumentTableLoadHandler.Handle(GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.DocumentTableLoadArgs)
member.summary: Overrides default loading of a particular object while creating a instance.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonDataLoadOptions
member.summary: Represents options for parsing JSON data.
member.remarks: An instance of this class can be passed into constructors of .

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonDataLoadOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class with default options.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonDataLoadOptions.SimpleValueParseMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a mode for parsing JSON simple values (null, boolean, number, integer, and string) while loading JSON. Such a mode does not affect parsing of date-time values. The default is .

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonDataLoadOptions.ExactDateTimeParseFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets an exact format for parsing JSON date-time values while loading JSON. The default is null.

remarks.para: Strings encoded using MicrosoftÂ® JSON date-time format (for example, "/Date(1224043200000)/") are always recognized as date-time values regardless of a value of this property. The property defines additional formats to be used while parsing date-time values from strings in the following way:

list.item: When is null, the ISO-8601 format and all date-time formats supported for the current, English USA, and English New Zealand cultures are used additionally in the mentioned order.
When is a non-empty string, it is used as a single additional date-time format utilizing the current culture.
When is an empty string, no additional date-time formats are used.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonDataLoadOptions.ExactDateTimeParseFormats
member.summary: Gets or sets exact formats for parsing JSON date-time values while loading JSON. The default is null.

remarks.para: Strings encoded using MicrosoftÂ® JSON date-time format (for example, "/Date(1224043200000)/") are always recognized as date-time values regardless of a value of this property. The property defines additional formats to be used while parsing date-time values from strings in the following way:

list.item: When is null, the ISO-8601 format and all date-time formats supported for the current, English USA, and English New Zealand cultures are used additionally in the mentioned order.
When contains strings, they are used as additional date-time formats utilizing the current culture.
When is empty, no additional date-time formats are used.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonDataLoadOptions.AlwaysGenerateRootObject
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether a generated data source will always contain an object for a JSON root element. If a JSON root element contains a single complex property, such an object is not created by default.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonDataSource
member.summary: Provides access to data of a JSON file or stream to be used while assembling a document.

remarks.para: To access data of the corresponding file or stream while assembling a document, pass an instance of this class as a data source to one of .AssembleDocument overloads.

In template documents, if a top-level JSON element is an array, a instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. If a top-level JSON element is an object, a instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. For more information, see template syntax reference (https://docs.groupdocs.com/display/assemblynet/Template+Syntax+-+Part+1+of+2#TemplateSyntax-Part1of2-UsingDataSources).
In template documents, you can work with typed values of JSON elements. For convenience, the engine replaces the set of JSON simple types with the following one:
The engine automatically recognizes values of the extra types upon their JSON representations.
To override default behavior of JSON data loading, initialize and pass a instance to a constructor of this class.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonDataSource.#ctor(System.String)

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonSimpleValueParseMode
member.summary: Specifies a mode for parsing JSON simple values (null, boolean, number, integer, and string) while loading JSON. Such a mode does not affect parsing of date-time values.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonSimpleValueParseMode.Loose
member.summary: Specifies the mode where types of JSON simple values are determined upon parsing of their string representations. For example, the type of 'prop' from the JSON snippet '{ prop: "123" }' is determined as integer in this mode.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.JsonSimpleValueParseMode.Strict
member.summary: Specifies the mode where types of JSON simple values are determined from JSON notation itself. For example, the type of 'prop' from the JSON snippet '{ prop: "123" }' is determined as string in this mode.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Provides classes for accessing data of external documents to be used while assembling a document.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.XmlDataLoadOptions
member.summary: Represents options for XML data loading.
member.remarks: An instance of this class can be passed into constructors of .

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.XmlDataLoadOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class with default options.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.XmlDataLoadOptions.AlwaysGenerateRootObject
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether a generated data source will always contain an object for an XML root element. If an XML root element has no attributes and all its child elements have same names, such an object is not created by default.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Data.XmlDataSource
member.summary: Provides access to data of an XML file or stream to be used while assembling a document.

remarks.para: To access data of the corresponding file or stream while assembling a document, pass an instance of this class as a data source to one of .AssembleDocument overloads.

In template documents, if a top-level XML element contains only a list of elements of the same type, an instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. Otherwise, an instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. For more information, see template syntax reference (https://docs.groupdocs.com/display/assemblynet/Template+Syntax+-+Part+1+of+2#TemplateSyntax-Part1of2-UsingDataSources).

When XML Schema Definition is passed to a constructor of this class, data types of values of simple XML elements and attributes are determined according to the schema. So in template documents, you can work with typed values rather than just strings.

When XML Schema Definition is not passed to a constructor of this class, data types of values of simple XML elements and attributes are determined automatically upon their string representations. So in template documents, you can work with typed values in this case as well. The engine is capable to automatically recognize values of the following types:
Note that for automatic recognition of data types to work, string representations of values of simple XML elements and attributes should be formed using invariant culture settings.
To override default behavior of XML data loading, initialize and pass a instance to a constructor of this class.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssembler.Options
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of flags controlling behavior of this instance while assembling a document.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssembler.BarcodeSettings
member.summary: Gets a set of settings controlling barcode generation while assembling a document.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssembler.KnownTypes
member.summary: Gets an unordered set (that is, a collection of unique items) containing objects which fully or partially qualified names can be used within document templates processed by this assembler instance to invoke the corresponding types' static members, perform type casts, etc.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssembler.UseReflectionOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether invocations of custom type members performed via reflection API are optimized using dynamic class generation or not. The default value is true.
member.remarks: There are some scenarios where it is preferrable to disable this optimization. For example, if you are dealing with small collections of data items all the time, then an overhead of dynamic class generation can be more noticeable than an overhead of direct reflection API calls.
member.dev: Normally, such settings should be located in configuration files, but it seems like there is no autoportable way to achieve this.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssemblyOptions
member.summary: Specifies options controlling behavior of while assembling a document.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssemblyOptions.None
member.summary: Specifies default options.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssemblyOptions.AllowMissingMembers
member.summary: Specifies that missing object members should be treated as null literals by the assembler. This option affects only access to instance (that is, non-static) object members and extension methods. If this option is not set, the assembler throws an exception when encounters a missing object member.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssemblyOptions.UpdateFieldsAndFormulas
member.summary: Specifies that fields of result Word Processing documents and formulas of result Spreadsheet documents should be updated by the assembler.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssemblyOptions.RemoveEmptyParagraphs
member.summary: Specifies that the assembler should remove paragraphs becoming empty after template syntax tags are removed or replaced with empty values.
member.remarks: At the moment, this option is supported only for templates of Word Processing, Presentation, and Email file formats.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Assembly.DocumentAssemblyOptions.InlineErrorMessages
member.summary: Specifies that the assembler should inline template syntax error messages into output documents. If this option is not set, the assembler throws an exception when encounters a syntax error.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.KnownTypeSet
member.summary: Represents an unordered set (that is, a collection of unique items) containing objects which fully or partially qualified names can be used within document templates to invoke the corresponding types' static members, perform type casts, etc.
member.dev: This class is just a facade of . Descriptional comments of these classes should be kept in sync.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.KnownTypeSet.Add(System.Type)

summary.para: Adds the specified object to the set. Throws in the following cases:
- represents an invisible type, i.e. a non-public type or a public nested type which has a non-public outer type.
- has been added to the set already.

member.param: A object to add.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.KnownTypeSet.Remove(System.Type)
member.summary: Removes the specified object from the set. Throws if is null.
member.param: A object to remove.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.KnownTypeSet.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items from the set.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.KnownTypeSet.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns An object to iterate over items of the set.
member.returns: An object to iterate over items of the set.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.KnownTypeSet.Count
member.summary: Gets the count of items in the set.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder that contains the GroupDocs component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.param: A stream that contains the license.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.License.IsLicensed
member.summary: Returns true if a valid license has been applied; false if the component is running in evaluation mode.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.LoadSaveOptions
member.summary: Specifies additional options for loading and saving of a document to be assembled.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.LoadSaveOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class without any properties specified.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.LoadSaveOptions.#ctor(GroupDocs.Assembly.FileFormat)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class with the specified file format to save an assembled document to.
member.param: A file format to save an assembled document to.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.LoadSaveOptions.SaveFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a file format to save an assembled document to. is the default.

remarks.para: When the value of this property is not specified, behaves as follows:
- When you specify a file path to save an assembled document, the save file format is determined upon file extension from the path.
- When you specify a stream to save an assembled document, the save file format remains the same as the file format of a loaded template document.

Beware that it is not always possible to save an assembled document to any file format using GroupDocs.Assembly. For example, it is impossible to save a document loaded from a Word Processing file format (such as DOCX) to a Spreadsheet file format (such as XLSX). For more information on possible combinations of load and save file formats supported by GroupDocs.Assembly, please check GroupDocs.Assembly online documentation.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.LoadSaveOptions.ResourceLoadBaseUri
member.summary: Gets or sets a base URI to resolve external resource files' relative URIs to absolute ones while loading an HTML template document to be assembled and saved to a non-HTML format. The default value is an empty string.

remarks.para: When loading an HTML document from a file, its containing folder is used as a base URI by default, which cannot happen when loading an HTML document from a stream. Set this property to specify a base URI when loading an HTML document from a stream or to override the default base URI when loading an HTML document from a file.
A value of this property is ignored in the following cases:

list.item: An HTML document being loaded contains a BASE HTML element providing a base URI.
An HTML document being loaded is to be assembled and saved to HTML (external resource files are not loaded and relative URIs are not changed then).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Assembly.LoadSaveOptions.ResourceSaveFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets a path to a folder to store external resource files while an assembled document loaded from a non-HTML format is being saved to HTML. The default value is an empty string.

remarks.para: By default, when saving an assembled document to an HTML file, external resource files are stored to a folder having the same name as the HTML file without extension plus the "_files" suffix. This folder is located in the same folder as the HTML file. However, this cannot be done when saving an assembled document to an HTML stream. Set this property to specify a path to a folder to store external resource files when saving an assembled document to an HTML stream or to override the default folder when saving an assembled document to an HTML file.
A value of this property is ignored if an assembled document being saved to HTML was loaded from HTML as well (external resource files are not stored and links to them are not changed then).

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Assembly.Metered
member.summary: Provides methods to work with metered licensing.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt to set metered public and private keys is made:
[C#]
Metered metered = new Metered(); metered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey");
[Visual Basic]
Dim metered As Metered = New Metered metered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey")

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Metered.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Metered.SetMeteredKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enables metered licensing for the component by specifying appropriate public and private metered keys.
member.param: The public metered key.
The private metered key.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Metered.GetConsumptionQuantity
member.summary: Returns the currently consumed number of megabytes.
member.returns: The currently consumed number of megabytes.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Assembly.Metered.GetConsumptionCredit
member.summary: Returns the currently consumed number of credits.
member.returns: The currently consumed number of credits.

summary.p: Provides classes for generating documents in popular office file formats based upon template documents and data obtained from various sources including databases, XML, JSON, OData, objects of custom .NET types, and more.

remarks.p: The central class of this namespace is . This class incorporates a set of settings to control document generation and performs document generation through its AssembleDocument overloads.
